declaration.accept: I confirm that I will administer the estate of the person who died according to law, and that my application is truthful.
declaration.confirm: I confirm that I will administer the estate of Megan Slattery, according to law. I will:
declaration.requests: If the probate registry (court) asks me to do so, I will:
declaration.confirmItem2: keep full details (an inventory) of the estate
declaration.confirmItem3: keep a full account of how the estate has been administered
declaration.requestsItem1: provide the full details of the estate and how it has been administered
declaration.requestsItem2: return the grant of probate to the court
declaration.submitWarning: Once you click ‘Save and continue’, you cannot change your answers.
declaration.understandItem1: my application will be rejected if I do not answer any questions about the information I have given
declaration.understandItem2: criminal proceedings for fraud may be brought against me if I am found to have been deliberately untruthful or dishonest

legalStatement.intro: This statement is based on the information you’ve given in your application. It will be stored as a public record.
legalStatement.deceased: Megan Slattery was born on 1 January 2000 and died on 1 January 2019, domiciled in England and Wales.
legalStatement.applicant: I, Megan Slattery of test, make the following statement:

executorsApplying.name: I am an executor named in the will as Megan Slattery, and I am applying for probate.
executorsApplying.sign: I will send to the probate registry what I believe to be the true and original last will and testament of Megan Slattery.

legalStatement.deceasedEstateLand: To the best of my knowledge, information and belief, there was no land vested in Megan Slattery which was settled previously to the death (and not by the will) of Megan Slattery and which remained settled land notwithstanding such death.
legalStatement.deceasedEstateValue: The gross value for the estate amounts to £12345 and the net value for the estate amounts to £12345.

headers: In the High Court of Justice

declarationItems.title: I, Megan Slattery of test, make the following statement:
Megan Slattery was born on 1 January 2000 and died on 1 January 2019, domiciled in England and Wales.

sections.title: The estate of the person who died

declarationItems.title: The gross value for the estate amounts to £12345 and the net value for the estate amounts to £12345.

To the best of my knowledge, information and belief, there was no land vested in Megan Slattery which was settled previously to the death (and not by the will) of Megan Slattery and which remained settled land notwithstanding such death.
I am an executor named in the will as Megan Slattery, and I am applying for probate.
I will send to the probate registry what I believe to be the true and original last will and testament of Megan Slattery.
I confirm that I will administer the estate of Megan Slattery, according to law. I will:
values: keep full details (an inventory) of the estate
keep a full account of how the estate has been administered

declarationItems.title: If the probate registry (court) asks me to do so, I will:
values: provide the full details of the estate and how it has been administered
return the grant of probate to the court

declarationItems.title: I understand that:
values: my application will be rejected if I do not answer any questions about the information I have given
criminal proceedings for fraud may be brought against me if I am found to have been deliberately untruthful or dishonest

questionAndAnswers.question: First name and any middle names
Did Megan Slattery have assets in another name?
Did Megan Slattery get married or enter into a civil partnership after the will was signed?
What was their date of birth?
What was the date that they died?
What was the permanent address at the time of their death?
Were any updates (‘codicils’) made to the will?
How was the Inheritance Tax (IHT) form submitted?
Gross value of the estate in £
Net value of the estate in £
How many past and present executors are named on the will and any updates (‘codicils’)?
First name and any middle names
Is your name ‘Megan Slattery’ exactly what appears on the will?

checkAnswersSummary.mainParagraph: Check the information below carefully. This will form a record of your application for probate. It will also be stored as a public record, and will be able to be viewed online.
